channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Canada loses its measles elimination status — as it happened
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Families of veterans fight for extended mental health care
item.description: Some 20 years after her husband was killed in a roadside bomb while serving in Afghanistan, Amanda Anderson says she feels abandoned by Veterans Affairs Canada.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: B.C. premier's office steps up Cowichan land ruling info campaign
item.description: 'A constituent reached out to me and said that they had received a letter,' Steve Kooner, MLA for Richmond-Queensborough told Global News.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Legion branch thrives with more than 500 members
item.description: The number of Royal Canadian Legion members has been climbing in Canada the last few years and at one legion branch on Henderson Highway, camaraderie and business are growing.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Anand says U.S. secretary Rubio has avoided '51st state' chatter as G7 meeting looms
item.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand says U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio hasn't repeated President Donald Trump's musings about making Canada the 51st state during their conversations.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Finance minister says critical minerals refining is the ‘name of the game'
item.description: Refining is the name of the game, and Canada can do better than just shipping raw materials south,” Champagne told a Calgary business audience after unveiling the federal budget.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: New flu strain could hit infants, elderly hard | Hanomansing Tonight
item.description: With flu cases now rising in Canada, medical experts are bracing for a difficult influenza season linked to the global spread of an evolving H3N2 strain that could be a mismatch for this year’s vaccine.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Some B.C. Conservative riding execs urge MLAs to oust Rustad
item.description: One riding executive said the party will "continue bleeding" support and won't be competitive next election if Rustad remains Opposition leader.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: How Canada Thumbs Its Nose at the Global Climate Summit
item.description: We used to pledge lower emissions. Now we push for higher oil production.

item.title: BC Government Blamed as Deaf Kids Lose Key Support
item.description: A society that’s supported families for 46 years says a provincial decision forced it to shut down.

item.title: Ontario considering order that would kill hundreds of new rental homes
item.description: Ontario’s housing minister is considering stepping in to quash a proposed rental development in north Toronto, over concerns raised by a pharmaceutical company.

item.title: Is Pierre Poilievre’s leadership in trouble?
item.description: After one MP crosses the floor, and another resigns completely, we look at the turmoil within the Conservative party, and what that means for Pierre Poilievre’s leadership.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Newfoundland's Between Breaths makes Western Canadian debut at the Firehall
item.description: A moving look at Dr. Jon Lien’s life, from rescuing whales to facing dementia.

item.title: Changed Rules Will Shut a Trans Bodybuilder Out of Competition
item.description: The Canadian association that regulates the sport will no longer allow gender-affirming hormone therapy, citing American rules.

item.title: Appeal hearing for Saskatoon police officer reaches final stage
item.description: Final testimonies and arguments for the appeal hearing of a fired Saskatoon police officer for his friendship with someone associated to a biker gang was heard Monday.

item.title: Photos: Belfast electronic duo Chalk light up the Fox Cabaret
item.description: The Irish duo made the most of their only Canadian tour stop.

item.title: The final scoop: Dolce Amore goes full service

item.title: DFO investigating 3rd whale death off B.C.'s coast within weeks
item.description: Caitlin Birdsall, executive director of the Marine Education and Research Society, says the whale discovered Nov. 8 off Lasqueti Island in the Georgia Strait near the Sunshine Coast and is the third confirmed death since late September.

item.title: Burton Cummings and Randy Bachman announce 2026 Canadian tour as the Guess Who
item.description: The legendary Canadian rock band will be kicking off its first tour in 23 years in Moncton on May 26, 2026.

item.title: A farmer, her flock, and the North they sustain
item.description: In B.C’s North Coast, Kieran McKeown, a third-generation farmer, blends innovation, integrity, and community spirit to feed a region and keep her family’s legacy alive.

item.title: Glitch Theatre debuts with neurodivergent-led premiere
item.description: New name, new mandate, and a neurodivergent-led creative team define the company’s 2025 launch.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Suki’s: Fifty-four years of style, education, and legacy
item.description: For 54 years, Suki’s has shaped Vancouver’s hair culture through artistry and education. Named Best Salon in the Georgia Straight’s Best of Vancouver 2025, the iconic brand continues to set the standard for innovation, collaboration, and timeless style—from its world-class Academy to its visionary team.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Nova Scotia's Kate Beaton has her Ducks in a row at Vancouver Writers Fest
item.description: The graphic novellist and children's book author makes her way to Vancouver.

item.title: We Stand on Guard Once More concert hoping 'to raise as much money as we can'
item.description: The sold-out concert featuring the best in Newfoundland and Labrador musical talent will be streamed across all local media channels this evening.
